instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01041: What is 820-01041? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .
definitions.PP5V_G3S: What is PP5V_G3S? PP5V_G3S is a 5v power rail present when the system is in a G3S standby state.
definitions.PP20V_USBC_XB_VBUS: What is PP20V_USBC_XB_VBUS? PP20V_USBC_XB_VBUS is 20v in from the USB-C charger on USB-C powered Macbook Pros..
definitions.PPVBAT_G3H_CONN: What is PPVBAT_G3H_CONN? This is the where the battery’s power rail connects to the motherboard. .
definitions.PP1V2_S3: What is PP1V2_S3? PP1V2_S3 is a 1.2v power rail present when the machine is in an S3 suspend to RAM state.
definitions.PPVCCSA_S0_CPU: What is PPVCCSA_S0_CPU? Main power rail for the CPU. If this is missing the machine will act braindead. This is NOT shorted to ground if it has a low resistance – this is a common mistake people make. A chip that requires high power at a low voltage like a CPU or GPU will have a low measured resistance to ground..
definitions.PPVCCIO_S0_CPU: What is PPVCCIO_S0_CPU? PPVCCIO_S0_CPU is a power rail responsible for powering the part of the CPU responsible for communicating with other portions of the machine prior to PPVCORE_S0_CPU being present and must be present before vcore, PPVCCIO_S0_CPU is present when the machine is in an on, RUNNING state. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power.
threads.message:
Got a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A that does not show signs of life. No visible damage.

The T2 chip is heating a bit. 

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 12.57v
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_SOCPMU</SIGNAL> = 3.3v
<SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> = 0v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_G3S</SIGNAL> = 5,13 then drops to 0v and again.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power.
threads.message: Did you try to put in DFU?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power.
threads.message: it connects but gives error when restoring

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power.
threads.message:
Board switches from 5V to 20V?
Check w/ and w/o battery.

Be sure to use 87/96W charger.
Try DFU with both charger and battery connected.
Connect charger before DFU cable.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power.
threads.message:
I get steady 20v on <SIGNAL>PP20V_USBC_XB_VBUS</SIGNAL> with the battery disconnected.

If the battery is connected then <SIGNAL>PP20V_USBC_XB_VBUS</SIGNAL> is 5v.

Charger is 96W.

Tried DFU with and without battery. Same thing.
Also charger connected first.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power.
threads.message:
All USB-C ports have the same behavior?
Test them in both ways connection.

Is the battery charging?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power.
threads.message:
Yes, all 4 ports go from 5v to 20v w/o battery

All 4 ports stuck on 5v with battery.

Ports doesnt work the other way around.

SCL/SDA = 3.3v

<SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CONN</SIGNAL>

I dont have usb amp meter. How can i check if battery is charging?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power.
threads.message: If the battery really charges, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> increases slowly; unless battery is full 100%.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power.
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> went from 12.62v to 13.02 in about 20 secs

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power.
threads.message:
What kind of error do you get in DFU?

Just in case, try with empty SoC ROM.
Don't forget to make backup first.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power.
threads.message:
It gives me the same error: "Unexpected device state ´DFU´ expected ´Recovery´ (Probable forced into DFU mode externally)
[.com.apple.MobileDevice.MobileRestore - 0xFAE (4014)]

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power.
threads.message:
Check diode mode to ground on all secondary power rails.
Don't forget SSD rails...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power.
threads.message:
PPVCCPRIMCORE_PRIM_REG is 45 ohms to ground.

Diode mode: 

<SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> .0000
<SIGNAL>PPVCCSA_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> 0.0004
<SIGNAL>PPVCCGT_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> 0.0001
<SIGNAL>PPVCCIO_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> 0.012
<SIGNAL>PP1V2_S3</SIGNAL> 0.05
<SIGNAL>PP1V2_S3_CPUDDR</SIGNAL> 0.05
<SIGNAL>PP1V05_PRIM</SIGNAL>  0.024
<SIGNAL>PPVCORE_S0_GPU</SIGNAL> 0.0000
<SIGNAL>PPVDDCI_S0_GPU</SIGNAL> 0.013
PP1V5R1V35_S0_GPU_MEM 0.021
PP1V5R1V35_S0_GPU_IC 0.021

Those are the rails where i got low resistances.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01041</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A no power.
threads.message:
CPU/GPU core coils have very low calues as normal.
However, VCCSA is possibly too low.
You should compare these values with good board.

BTW, use ohm scale for low readings in diode mode.
